title: Preparation of Denaturing Polyacrylamide Gels and Silver Staining
original description: This is the protocol for the preparation of denaturing polyacrylamide gels and silver staining
steps:
PREPARATION OF DENATURING POLYACRYLAMIDE GELS
1. 


2. Clean the surfaces of each plate with acetone using the toilet paper.
3. Apply 1mL of the methacryloxypropyl trimethoxysilane (PlusOne Bind-Silane; Amersham Pharmacia Biotech) / ethanol-acetic acid (5% glacial acetic acid in 95% ethanol) to the glass plate to adhere the gel. 
Note: Use a sheet of toilet paper to spread a solution on the plate.
4. Apply 1 ml of 2% dimethyldichlorosilane in octamethylcyclotetrasiloxane (PlusOne Repel-Silane ES; Amersham Pharmacia Biotech) to the bigger plate to prevent gel adhesion and allow plaque separation after electrophoresis. 
Note: Use a sheet of toilet paper to spread a solution on the board.
5. Mount both plates facing each other with 0.4mm thick spaces. Attach them with side clips.
6. Add 60ml of 6% acrylamide gel, 480 μL of 10% ammonium persulfate and 25 μL of TEMED.
7. Apply the gel between the plates. Avoid blistering until reaching the lower end.
8. Carefully insert the comb. Allow 1 to 2 hours for complete polymerization.
9. SAMPLE PREPARATION
10. Add 8μl of denaturing buffer (0.05% xylenecianol [w / v], 0.05% bromophenol blue [w / v] and 20mM EDTA in formamide) to 2μL of the amplification reaction.
11. Denature the samples for 5 min at 95 ° C.
12. Place samples immediately on ice.
13. PRE-ELECTROPHORESIS AND ELETROPHORESIS
14. Pre-run in TBE 1X buffer at 120W for 1 h, or until the temperature of the glass plates reaches 55 ° C.
15. Apply 3μL of each sample to the gel.
16. Run at 80W for 60-90 minutes at 50 ° - 56 ° C.
17. SILVER STAINING (Creste et al., 2001 with modifications).
18. Disassemble gel apparatus, separating the glass plates. The entire staining procedure will be performed with the gel adhered to the smaller plate.
19. Fix: incubate the gel in 2L of fixative solution (10% ethanol, 1.0% acetic acid) for 10 minutes (shake gently).
20. Rinse with distilled water for 1 minute.
21. Pretreatment: Incubate the gel in 2L of 1.5% nitric acid solution for 3 minutes (shake gently).
22. Rinse with distilled water for 1 minute.
23. Staining: Impregnate gel with 2L of 0.2% silver nitrate solution for 20 minutes. (shake gently).
24. Rinse with distilled water for 1 minute.
25. Develop gel by applying, 1L developing solution (30g / L Na2CO3 and 0.54 mL / L 37% formaldehyde) until the bands appear (5 to 10 minutes). Formaldehyde must be added at the time of use. The developing solution should be cooled in a refrigerator.
26. Stop developing reaction: Incubate the gel in 2L of 5.0% acetic acid solution to stop the development.
27. Wash the gel rapidly in distilled water. Air dry and photograph
